data.title: Fixed TD shellmap mammoth turrets drawn below body
data.body:
On bleed, the turrets of the mammoth tanks on the TD shellmap are drawn below the body. This is an initialization order issue, different ZOffsets don't help.

Note1: This is a band-aid, we need #8848 to fix this properly.
Note2: This was probably introduced in #9004, but we should check the release branch just in case.

data.title: Easier access to statistics after game is over
data.body:
After the game is over and the "who won" screen pops up there used to be a "statistics" button.
Since it has been removed you have to click "Return to map" and then a statistics icon to see the thing.
Not only a longer process but also much harder to find/less intuitive.

I think the button should be put back, just below the "who won" list.

data.title: Infantry getting run over/crushed before (visual) contact
data.body:
(playtest: 20150808)
http://imgur.com/3zd1vLy
[21:03] <+hamb> pi99y: i suspect this is because the crushing does not care about subcells
[21:04] <+hamb> they are both entering the same cell, infantry first, and it looks funny because the infantry is in the northern part of the cell

Replay: http://www.filedropper.com/runover
Happens at cca 6:47 just above starting position labaled as "F", Haos Ridges.

Also: body appears above harvester as it runs over it

data.title: yaml inheritance breaks in conjunction with yaml removals
data.body:
Adding the following piece of yaml to a map.yaml...

``` yaml
^A:
        ProximityCaptor:
DOG:
        Inherits@a: ^A
```

... causes breakage:

```
OpenRA.Utility(1,1): Error: Actor type dog: Bogus yaml removals: TakeCover
```

It works as expected on https://github.com/pchote/OpenRA/tree/yaml-removals

data.title: Fixed a resource leak in MapPreview
data.body: This was detected by Coverity.

data.title: Fixed undefined sequence lint checks not emitting errors
data.body: These problems are always serious so by definition they should be errors not optional warnings. It will also exit with 1 then, which will notify us via CI build checks earlier on.

data.title: Fixed BodyOrientation refactor regressions
data.body: Another followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9004 which fixes problems discovered by Coverity and myself.

data.title: Long bridge engineer repair is broken
data.body: It seems the path finder does not allow it to enter the invisible bridge hut. Test map: Poland raid.

data.title: Fix TS regression from #9004
data.body: No idea how this passed the lint checks...

data.title: Refactor/reorganize UpgradeRules
data.body:
While I can see why they are necessary, for me they are often responsible for the majority of not-automatically-solvable rebase conflicts, and additionally a major pain to navigate, due how large the file has become.

It would be nice if we found a solution to at least reduce rebase conflicts, as these are extremely annoying.

data.title: Remove RenderBuilding
data.body:
Replaces the four traits inheriting `RenderBuilding` with solutions based on `WithSpriteBody`.
Replaces `RenderBuilding` with `WithSpriteBody` + `RenderSprites` + `AutoSelectionSize`.

Supercedes #8753.

data.title: Friendly name for HashSet in docs
data.body: Requested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9181#issuecomment-135579391.

data.title: Fix culture in FieldSaver for collections
data.body:
Ensure arrays and sets format all elements in their collections. This ensures they use the invariant culture and other formatting correctly.

Currently, the formatting of a type depends on if it is in a collection or not, which is not ideal.

data.title: Combine Shrapnel into Bullet
data.body: Not quite satisfied with this, and am looking for feedback. I'm not familiar enough with the codebase to know the best way to profile performance and memory usage and ensure that this doesn't have any negative impacts. I'm also not sure if moving the `Sync`ed properties to a parent class messes anything up, or if making anything readonly or protected risks messing with `Sync`. I also haven't been able to test it in multiplayer. Again, comments and criticism welcome.

data.title: D2k fix for cliff passability
data.body: Fixes passability on some d2k cliffs.

data.title: Clean up OpenRA repository(?)
data.body:
There are a few branches here that look like they can be deleted, but I'm not 100% sure on any of them (because it puzzles me that they are still there to begin with).
- water-troopers
- revert-8501-bleed_streams
- coverity-badge
- avoid-duplicate-overcrowded-bugs
- desktop-l10n

data.title: Improve/refactor WithCargo

... to cache passenger facings on transport enter/exit instead of `Tick` (mentioned in #9172), possibly rewrite it to use `ActorPreview` instead of `ModifyRender`.

data.title: Add support for Dictionary to FieldLoader and FieldSaver
data.body:
Inspired by #9181, this makes `FieldLoader` capable of loading `Dictionary<,>` directly, instead of traits relying on their own code to load them in a number of different ways.
Also `FieldSaver` is not left out, and is able to save them as YAML (for saving maps) and potentially as string, for trait documentation generation.

As usual, split into nice small easy to review commits.

Easiest way to test this is with my `PlugInit` PR, because that uses both the `FieldLoader` and `FieldSaver` changes.

data.title: Support HashSet in FieldLoader/FieldSaver
data.body:
Adds support to load and save a `HashSet` directly.

This means classes can directly use a set if they need set-based operations, rather than suffering the cost of querying an array.

Lots of places may benefit from changing to sets eventually, for the moment I have limited it to simplifying `WeaponInfo` which was already creating a set for performance reasons.

data.title: Check if cloaked in TargetableBuilding
data.body:
Partially adresses #9157 (the attacking issue, but not the cursor).

Attack cursor still shows up, unfortunately, but attacking cloaked buildings is not possible anymore.

data.title: Fix radar not showing frozen actors

milestone.title: Future
milestone.description: This milestone is meant for stuff we want fixed, but don't have a timeline for yet. Also a collection of pull requests left undone.

data.body:
Fixes #9155.

Also saves trait lookups on every render tick in `AppearsOnRadar`.

Individual commits should be pretty simple to review on a 1-by-1 basis.
Not sure if we want this for stable.

data.title: Move duplicate Tick() code from Plane and Helicopter to Aircraft.
Minimap shows resource change under fog
data.body: You can see on the minimap where resources are spreading and being harvested under the Fog of War. Most visible with the Grow Resources debug option.

data.title: Update MaxMind.GeoIP2 version to 2.3.1
data.body: Fixes an "Operation did not complete successfully because the file contains a virus." message when making dependencies.

data.title: Customizable impact victim scan radius
data.body: Fixes #9173.

data.title: Something is off about warhead spread/health radius interaction
data.body:
![zero-damage](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2857877/9502463/bd557f40-4c31-11e5-84b4-fa80a91ffda8.png)

Health radius `1c0` on the cyard, `Spread: 96` on the `QuadRockets`, gave `BlocksProjectiles` trait to cyard, missiles explodes barely within health radius, zero damage. 
As far as I understand the concept of the health radius and spread, it should deal full damage within 96 wdist units (3 pixel in d2k) of the outer border of the health radius, 37% at 192 wdist/6px etc.

data.title: Fixed a desync involving WithCargo
data.body: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/9099 with performance fixes applied. Closes #9094.

data.title: Do dogs attack differently now (less efficiently)?
data.body:
(playtest 20150808)
It seems to me that dogs score much less kills than before. Try attack-moving them into enemy infantry...
Have their attack jumps been disabled? It seems that they don't reach their targets fast enough and get killed even before they attack. It happens way too often.

While I could be wrong it feels quite off to me.

You can easely test on your own but here's a sample replay (see just after 8th minute, just above pink base) for some serious dog slaughter...

http://www.filedropper.com/dogs

data.title: ProductionAirdrop in RA
data.body:
I'm experimenting with the Nod-like production of vehicles with RA Airfield; I've defined the Reinforce audio and a C17 actor, but still I'm receiving this error when I actually build a unit:

```
Exception of type `System.Collections.Generic.KeyNotFoundException`: The given key was not present in the dictionary.
   at System.Collections.Generic.Dictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.ReadOnlyDictionary`2.get_Item(TKey key)
   at OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.Traits.ProductionAirdrop.<Produce>c__AnonStorey0.<>m__0(World w)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
```
